page.title: 17POCKET MONEY SURVEY,HESSLE
page.content: A survey amongst 9 year old primary schoolchildren about pocket money revealed the following results: {8%}were given no pocket money {14%}were given{20p}per week {27%}were given{50p}per week {28%}were given{Â£1} per week {7%}were given{Â£1.20}per week {9%}were given{Â£1.50}per week {7%}were given{Â£2}per week Inevitably the favourite purchases were sweets - often from one particular newsagents shop (Turnbulls) in Hessle Square, but the survey also found that many children also saved some of their pocket money by banking it.
